bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, May 31, 1899
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p: No. 30, Consular Series. Legation of the United States, Monrovia Liberia, May 31, 1899.

p.add: INDEX BUREAU REC'D 7 '99 DEPT OF STATE

div1.p: Owen L. W. Smith, To Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State Washington.
Subject. Change of schedule of Steamers from Liverpool, for Liberia.
Synopsis. Only one Steamer per month from Liverpool to Monrovia. Four per month from Hamberg to Monrovia.
No. 30, Consular Series. Legation of the United States Monrovia Liberia; May 31, 1899.
Hon. David J. Hill, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington.

Sir: I have the honor to transmit to you the intelligence that the schedule of the English Steamers, from Liverpool to Monrovia, has been recently, so changed that we shall now have only one Steamer per month from Liverpool. At the same time we have a Steamer sailing weekly from Hamburg, calling at Monrovia. The German Steamer make, by far the fastest time. If it is possible that you can so arrange with the
the Post Office. Department at New York, so as to forward mail matters for Liberia, by way of Hamburg, you will greatly facilitate, as well as, accelerate its transit.
I have the honor to be your obedient servant, Owen L. W. Smith, M. R. and C. General
